intro: Spyridium parvifolium var. parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved spyridium, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a low-growing shrub with small, narrow leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities in its region.
